text.__SUMMARY__: Hypericum collinum is a wiry perennial herb in the genus Hypericum, in the section Graveolentia.
text.Description: The species is 30 to 50 centimeters tall. It has five yellow petals with round, red veined flowers.
text.Distribution:
Mexico is where the species is most often found, more specifically in Veracruz, Oaxaca, Puebla and Hidalgo.
